channel.title: Huge Private Server Requirements
channel.description: I want to have a private server that can hold 300+ users. I have a VPS host that offers for a price 1280 MB of RAM, 15 GB Disk Space, and 400 GB bandwith. This is for a 1 month plan which costs $44.00 USD per month. I am contacting them to find out if this is even possible to run on a VPS. For the main questions i have i am wondering if the batch file that recognizes connections is enough to process so many connections. Especially HD clients. What do you think? Are there any other server specs i should get that may be a major factor before hosting with this company?

item.description:

[quote=“davidi2, post:41, topic:289296”]So your saying every correction is a contradiction? “Mom, I want an apple. Wait, never mind, I want an orange.” That is the way I used my statement. In order to speak against my self, it would have had to be like this: “Mom, I want an apple. Mom, I want an orange.”

Your mom would probably ask which you actually wanted, because you contradicted yourself. The first statment makes it obvious that you are correct yourself, and changing your mind. This works the same way:

[quote]4. Jagex actually does have 200 computers, one per server. Well not exactly… They have one hard drive per server and A big “server station” which hold about 25 servers each. [/quote] = correction
4. Jagex actually does have 200 computers. They have one hard drive per server and A big “server station” which hold about 25 servers each.
= contradiction[/quote]

Your first example is a contradiction to your initial thought. That’s been my point this whole time.

item.title: Huge Private Server Requirements
item.description:
@11167 wrote:

[quote=“davidi2, post:39, topic:289296”][quote author=_ link=topic=382438.msg2872683#msg2872683 date=1247859664]

Well not exactly…

By saying that, I correct my self. If I had not said that, you would be right. i would have been contradicting myself. And even still, you only would have had 1/5 of the definition.

Dictionary.com again (crossed out irrelevent one)

[quote]cor⋅rec⋅tion
/kəˈrɛkʃən/ Show Spelled Pronunciation [kuh-rek-shuhn] Show IPA
Use correction in a Sentence
noun

  1. something that is substituted or proposed for what is wrong or inaccurate; emendation.
  2. the act of correcting.
  3. punishment intended to reform, improve, or rehabilitate; chastisement; reproof.
  4. Usually, corrections. the various methods, as incarceration, parole, and probation, by which society deals with convicted offenders.
  5. a quantity applied or other adjustment made in order to increase accuracy, as in the use of an instrument or the solution of a problem: A five degree correction will put the ship on course.
    6. a reversal of the trend of stock prices, esp. temporarily, as after a sharp advance or decline in the previous trading sessions.[/quote]

In the English language, words can be twisted, or used with slight altercations. Dictionary.com lists those altercations as well as its direct meaning. Also,

[quote author=dictionary.com]contradiction

c.1382, from L. contradictionem, from contradicere “speak against,” from contra “against” + dicere “to speak” (see diction). Contradict first attested 1570s, “speak against;” sense of “assert the contrary” is from 1582.[/quote]

You spoke against your main point by switching the noun being described.
[/quote]
No switch, I said it was a correction, you said contradiction. I gave details on both. And how does your quote support your cause at all?[/quote]

You initially stated computers and then moved away from the thought, and the quote states that you spoke against yourself.

Read full topic

item.title: Huge Private Server Requirements
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

_™:

Still you contradict yourself by saying, “Jagex actually does have 200 computers, one per server. Well not exactly…” Make up your mind, please.

Thats not a contradiction… its a correction. I meant 200 hard drives, which is what I said during the CORRECTION. Contradictions are when you say something, then say something exactly the opposite. Such as: “This room has been painted completly blue. This room is orange.” or “Jagex has 200 computers to run servers. Jagex has 150 computers to run servers.”

From DICTIONARY.com

con⋅tra⋅dic⋅tion /ˌkɒntrəˈdɪkʃən/ Show Spelled Pronunciation [kon-truh-dik-shuhn] Show IPA Use contradiction in a Sentence –noun 1. the act of contradicting; gainsaying or opposition. 2. assertion of the contrary or opposite; denial. 3. a statement or proposition that contradicts or denies another or itself and is logically incongruous. 4. direct opposition between things compared; inconsistency. 5. a contradictory act, fact, etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Huge Private Server Requirements
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

andrew4444:

For the main questions i have i am wondering if the batch file that recognizes connections is enough to process so many connections.

The batch file itself doesn’t process connections, the client handling code is in the .java files, which are then compiled and executed using the batch file.

andrew4444:

Especially HD clients.

HD clients aren’t intensive on the server side, the graphic upgrades are handled on the client side.

andrew4444:

What do you think? Are there any other server specs i should get that may be a major factor before hosting with this company?

The bandwidth/disk space/RAM you have is suitable to handle 300 clients. You have more than enough disk space, and you likely won’t be getting anywhere near that amount of bandwidth usage in a month. More RAM would help, but since it’s a dedicated server and you won’t be running any of your own apps, it should be fine. The only thing you need to check out is how many connections you can have open.

Also, in regard to hosting from home vs. hosting on a dedicated server, hosting on a dedicated server is preferrable since internet failures / power outages happen much more often locally. You also get the ability to turn your computer off without disrupting your server, saving you a significant amount of money for power usage.

Read full topic
